title: segfault on ridiculously small data set.
body:
```
peng_motif '/tmp/foo.fasta' -t 100 -w 8 -bg-model-order 1 -b 0.75 -a 1000 \
     -em-threshold 0.08 -em-max-iterations 100 -threads 4 -o '/tmp/foo.out' -strand PLUS
```

segfaults on http://pastebin.com/DwDmZsAm

works without `-strand PLUS`

title: -version command line argument
body: please consider implementing a `-version` command line argument, that simply prints the version number and exits with 0. We might eventually need that for the wrapper.

title: command line inconsistency between peng and shoot_peng
body:
shoot_peng cannot be used with advanced options because of a mismatch in the optional argument style:

e.g peng uses `-strand`, shoot_peng wants to set `--strand`.

title: shoot_peng should be integrated into BaMM-suite
body:
BaMM-suite will eventually become the main wrapper around all our tools. To integrate peng_motif, following things have to be done:

- [x] search for all required scripts and binaries in the PATH, remove hard-coded paths
- [ ] install shoot_peng as part of a python package. This will allow to avoid duplication of the command line parser
- [ ] rewrite shoot_peng so that it uses a function `add_arguments(argparse_parser)` which adds arguments to a given parser
- [ ] integrate shoot_peng into the `bamm_wrapper` 
- [ ] document all options using the sphinx documentation in the BaMMs-suite repository

title: include <cmath> in the peng.cpp file
body:
without #include <cmath> in the peng.cpp file, it shows error when compiling PEnG-motif on Max OS, saying that:

error: 'log' is not a member of 'std' 
...

title: Can this copying step be avoided?
Here it needs to output the values in scientific notation to avoid the rounding problem
Docker image
body:
I am having hard time installing on a machine
Linux 64dc5edce39d 4.9.49-moby #1 SMP Wed Sep 27 23:17:17 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

It would be good if you have Dockerfile for installing these in a standard ubuntu or other linux machine.

title: C+G content is 40% while A+T content is 60%
Bug report
body:
Hello Developer, 

My name is Enas and I am a Ph.D. student. My research focuses on static code analysis. I was looking for open-source software to collect some static code analysis tool warnings. I checked your source code, and I ran one of static code analysis tools over the source code. A number of warnings were generated; some of them may represent true defects in the source code and some may represent false reports, where the tool shows a defect but in reality there is none. 

I need your help by going through the warnings and checking if any of them represent a true defect in your source code. To do that, kindly find the attached file, which contains the warnings. 

Your response and help are highly appreciated. 

Thanks, 
Enas 
 
[FF.xlsx](https://github.com/soedinglab/PEnG-motif/files/2873399/FF.xlsx)
